oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Considerations by Southern White Students of their roles in the struggle for Democracy in the South
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: 1961 publication by the Highlander Folk School on actions white students' role in fulfilling democracy for all in the South. Actions include civil disobedience, passive resistance, how to organize, and how white students can be allies to their Black counterparts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Civil rights; School integration; Segregation in education; Civil disobedience; Segregation--Law and legislation; Civil rights demonstrations; Civil rights movements; Student movements; Students--Political activity; Passive resistance; Student newspapers and periodicals; National Association for the Advancement of Colored People; Petitions; African American universities and colleges
